about_the_game:
"Inn Trouble" is a management game where you run a fairy-tale inn. The game offers varying levels of difficulty, allowing you to play as a relaxed cozy experience or as a challenging economic simulator where complex decisions shape your success—you get to pick your own style. Either way, the game will do its best to make you smile.

Here are some of the things you’ll take care of:

  • Turning abandoned spaces into guest rooms. At the start, you only have functional areas, and every guest room must be unlocked before it can be used.

  • Decorating rooms with furniture. Choose wisely what furniture fits where and how to maximize comfort and appeal.

  • Researching new technologies to refine room decor. Initially, you'll only have access to basic furniture that barely meets guests' needs. If you want them to be thrilled, you’ll have to upgrade.

  • Entertaining unique fairy-tale guests. Adding a personal touch to rooms is key. After all, you wouldn’t expect a vampire to sleep on a bed with plain white sheets, like some kind of princess, would you?

  • Anticipating future guests and preparing rooms accordingly. Especially on higher difficulties, your plan must account for different guest types—or you’ll find yourself in big trouble.

  • Monitoring guest mood. Guest behavior and your revenue depend heavily on their satisfaction. If you give a vampire a princess bed, can you guess what kind of review he’ll leave?

  • Ensuring guests don’t bother each other. They’ll often want to, especially if they’re in a bad mood—and especially if they run into creatures they don’t get along with, even on a good day.

  • Handling things when they go off-plan. Fires, floods, rats, and other disasters are bound to happen. Hopefully, you have a backup plan for when a guest’s room isn’t quite up to snuff!

  • Feeding guests delicious meals. Who doesn’t love taking the elevator down to the inn’s restaurant? Meals must be great, and the elevator should be functional to avoid queues—otherwise, an unhappy vampire could end up next to a nervous elf, and who knows where that’ll lead...

  • Creating a beautiful garden for strolls. The garden is a perfect place for guests to enjoy each other's company and the surrounding beauty—or to engage in a delightful brawl.

  • Preparing a grand hall for the arrival of the Main Guest. Whether it’s the Dark Overlord or the Benevolent King, you’d better figure it out in advance—otherwise, preparing accordingly might be impossible.

  • And much more!

Running a magical inn rarely goes according to plan and almost always brings a mountain of trouble. But isn't it all the sweeter when you solve the problems and earn a glowing review?

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows® 10 64-bit (latest Service Pack)
  • Processor: Intel® Core™ i3 or AMD Phenom™ X3 8650
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 600 series, AMD Radeon™ HD 7000 series
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1 GB available space

short_description: Please sign below to take ownership of a magical inn. After all, everyone knows that running a cozy establishment, entertaining guests, breaking up elf and zombie brawls, extinguishing fires, and always teetering on the edge of bankruptcy is pure bliss! Or is it? Thanks for signing! Good luck!
